intro: Didymocarpus breviflorus, commonly known as the short-flowered wax tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and waxy, dark green leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
